g:HTMLPanel.p: This is the set of examples that goes with the GWTiA JSNI chapter
Computed Style - A simple example of JSNI in action to implement the DOM getComputedStyle method. It uses deferred binding to manage browser differences.
JavaScript Object - Exploring how to use JavaScriptObject and JavaScript Overlays to create a person object in JavaScript and change some details (most of the excitement is in the actual code).
Wrapping JSON - Displays some photos live from Picassa; data is retrieved using the JsonpRequestBuilder object, we then use Overlays on that data to access the JSONP structure.

Geolocate - This example shows geolocation in action on browsers that support it. JSNI is used to call the browser's geolocate functionality and also make calls back into a Java LocationHandler object on success/failure. If successful, the location is displayed on a Google Map (which itself is accessed via the gwt apis library, essentially a huge JSNI wrapping exercise made available from Google so you can treat Google Maps, and some other apis, as java objects in your applications)
